amendment.description: Amendment increases contribution limits for House candidates in response to personal expenditures by wealthy opponents.
amendment.purpose: Amendment numbered 10 printed in the Congressions Record February 12, 2002 to triple hard money contribution limits and allow additional coordinated expenditures for House candidates facing wealthy self-financed opponents. The adjusted limits would be triggered when the wealthy opponent has spent more than $350,000 of personal wealth, taking into account as offsets both the personal wealth spent by the non-wealthy candidate and the accumulated campaign funds of both candidates.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Capito amendment (A008) Agreed to by voice vote.
